contentHtml:
Longest Repeating Character Replacement

You have a string sss and an integer kkk which represents how many characters you can change to an uppercase English character to get the longest substring. The substring contains the same uppercase character.

  • s="AABABBA"s = "AABABBA"s="AABABBA"
  • k=1k = 1k=1
    • Output:4Output: 4Output:4
    • You can replace the character "A""A""A" at s[3]s[3]s[3] to get "BBBB""BBBB""BBBB". It is also possible to replace the character "B""B""B" at s[2]s[2]s[2] to get "AAAA""AAAA""AAAA".

How to Solve?

Take a look at the first 5 characters of s="AABABBA"s = "AABABBA"s="AABABBA". The first 5 characters are "AABAB""AABAB""AABAB" and the B repeats twice.

How can we remove the first three elements to get "AB""AB""AB" to satisfy the condition where k=1k = 1k=1? This intuition is how we are going to implement our algorithm.

Sliding Window

We should create a sliding window starting at the first index of the string. This is because at least one character is needed to evaluate when:

  • 0<=k<=s.length()0 <= k <= s.length()0<=k<=s.length()

We should track the count of the characters in a string using a hash map. The hash map stores the characters, but is used primarily for evaluating the count of a single character of the string at the index of the right pointer.

  • cnt={}cnt = \{\}cnt={}
  • Remember how hash maps work?
    • {Key:Value}\{ Key: Value \}{Key:Value} pair.

Utilizing this knowledge, we can store the max frequency of a character in a string at s[r]s[r]s[r] up until rrr using a variable and the max()max()max() function. The right pointer is denoted with rrr.

There should also be a result variable to return the longest substring we can create so far. Let's assign a left and right pointer to the beginning of the list to create our sliding window.

  • l=0l = 0l=0
  • r=0r = 0r=0
  • maxFreq=0maxFreq = 0maxFreq=0
left right string

We cannot update the left and right pointer anymore. The right pointer goes out of bounds. Return the result variable.

Helpful Hints

  • How to create a hash map?
    • cnt={}cnt = \{\}cnt={}
  • How to get the max of two elements?
    • max(x,y)max(x, y)max(x,y)

Sliding Window Solution

class Solution:
    def characterReplacement(self, s: str, k: int) -> int:
        # Set a left pointer
        l = 0
        # Create a character hash map
        cnt = {}
        # Set a max frequency variable
        maxFreq = 0
        # Set the maximum substring
        res = 0

        # Iterate r from 0 to the end of the list
        for r in range(len(s)):
            # Add the character to the char set
            cnt[s[r]] = 1 + cnt.get(s[r], 0)
            # Get the maximum character frequency
            maxFreq = max(maxFreq, cnt[s[r]])

            # Check if frequency of characters
            # Exceeds the maximum frequency
            # Increment the left pointer
            if (r - l + 1) - maxFreq > k:
                cnt[s[l]] -= 1
                l += 1
            
            # Get the maximum substring
            res = max(res, (r - l + 1))

        return res
title: Longest Repeating Character Replacement
